page.title: 16Gloucester to London
page.content: After passing over Magdalen Bridge in Oxford, The Flying Machine went by way of Henley, Maidenhead and over Hounslow Heath to Hammersmith and so into London along Knightsbridge to the Gloucester Coffee House in Piccadilly where some passengers would end their journey. And then on down The Haymarket and The Strand to the Bolt-and-Tun in Fleet Street. The fare from Gloucester to London was twenty three shillings and eight passengers were carried. On the next page is a full description of an advert for the Gloucester Flying Machine taken from The Gloucester Journal of 1756.
